ground_truth: The Colonel, deeply troubled, enters silently through the door and starts going through Ricky's bureau. He opens a drawer where Ricky keeps his marijuana but doesn't discover its false bottom. The Colonel stands and looks around, noticing the Digicam and a stack of cassettes on a shelf. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, staring off into space. The Colonel takes the cassette out of the Digicam and inserts another, his face tightening as he views the TV screen. He sinks slowly onto Ricky's bed, mesmerized. Later, naked except for his black socks, the Colonel grabs dumbbells and starts lifting them, watching his reflection in the window. The camera remains connected to the TV. Lester, wearing a Mr. Smiley's uniform, happily flips burgers on a grill. He suddenly looks up when he hears something, his face darkening, but then he smiles and puts his spatula down. Carolyn drives a Mercedes to the drive-thru window, with Buddy sitting beside her, too involved to notice Lester watching them. Lester leans out of the window, grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring blankly. Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin but struggles to appear nonchalant. The sky fills with ominous gray clouds, and wind whips garbage across the parking lot as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar. Gripping the wheel tightly, Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy looks at her unhappily, then gets out of the car and shuts the door. She starts to cry as Buddy's Jaguar speeds off, leaving her alone in the parking lot. Carolyn closes her eyes tightly, tries to stop the tears, and suddenly screams as loud as she can, the sound still muffled. The Colonel puts down the weights and looks at his reflection in the window, seeing his pumped arms, before reaching under the bench to grab a cigar box. He smiles, opens it, and digs through marijuana paraphernalia, only to find an empty Ziploc bag. Ricky and the Colonel sit at the table, eating in silence, when Ricky pulls his beeper off his belt and checks it, then heads into the hall, leaving the Colonel uneasy. It's raining outside, and Angela drives, squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth. The Colonel sees something outside that catches his eye, craning his neck for a better look. Through a window over the sink, blurred by the rain, Lester is visible in the Burnham's garage, his upper body pumped and glistening in sweat as he counts out a wad of bills.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The Commander, profoundly distressed, enters quietly through the entrance and begins going through Ricky's dresser. He opens a drawer where Ricky stores his cannabis but doesn't uncover its secret bottom. The Commander stands and glances around, noticing the Camcorder and a pile of tapes on a shelf. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, staring off into emptiness. The Commander takes the tape out of the Camcorder and inserts another, his face tightening as he views the TV display. He sinks slowly onto Ricky's bed, captivated. Later, unclothed except for his black socks, the Commander grasps dumbbells and begins raising them, watching his reflection in the pane. The camera remains connected to the TV. Lester, wearing a Mr. Smiley's outfit, cheerfully flips burgers on a grill. He suddenly glances up when he perceives something, his face darkening, but then he grins and puts his spatula down. Carolyn drives a Mercedes to the drive-thru window, with Buddy sitting beside her, too engaged to notice Lester observing them. Lester leans out of the window, smiling at Carolyn with bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl stands next to him gazing blankly. Carolyn almost leaps out of her skin but struggles to appear casual. The sky fills with threatening gray clouds, and wind whips trash across the parking lot as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar. Clutching the wheel tightly, Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy glances at her unhappily, then exits the car and shuts the door. She starts to weep as Buddy's Jaguar speeds off, leaving her solitary in the parking lot. Carolyn closes her eyes tightly, attempts to stop the tears, and suddenly yells as loud as she can, the sound still muted. The Commander puts down the weights and looks at his reflection in the pane, seeing his pumped arms, before reaching under the bench to grasp a cigar box. He smiles, opens it, and rummages through cannabis paraphernalia, only to find an empty Ziploc bag. Ricky and the Commander sit at the table, eating in silence, when Ricky pulls his pager off his belt and checks it, then heads into the corridor, leaving the Commander uneasy. It's raining outside, and Angela drives, squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth. The Commander sees something outside that catches his eye, craning his neck for a better view. Through a window over the basin, blurred by the rain, Lester is visible in the Burnham's garage, his upper body pumped and glistening in perspiration as he counts out a bundle of bills.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The door is silently entered by the deeply troubled Colonel, and Ricky's bureau is started to be gone through by him. A drawer is opened by him where marijuana is kept by Ricky, but its false bottom is not discovered by the Colonel. He stands and looks around, noticing the Digicam and a stack of cassettes on a shelf. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts stares off into space while she sits at the kitchen table. The cassette is taken out of the Digicam by the Colonel, and another is inserted, his face tightening as the TV screen is viewed by him. He slowly sinks onto Ricky's bed, mesmerized. Later, naked except for his black socks, dumbbells are grabbed by the Colonel, who starts to lift them while watching his reflection in the window. The TV remains connected to the camera. Wearing a Mr. Smiley's uniform, Lester happily flips burgers on a grill. When something is heard by him, he suddenly looks up, his face darkening, but then a smile is given as the spatula is put down by him. Driven by Carolyn, the Mercedes is pulled to the drive-thru window, with Buddy sitting beside her, too involved to notice Lester, who watches them. The window is leaned out of by Lester, grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring blankly. Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin but struggles to appear nonchalant. Ominous gray clouds fill the sky, and garbage is whipped across the parking lot by the wind as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar. Gripping the wheel tightly, the wheel is stared at by Carolyn straight ahead while Buddy looks at her unhappily, then shuts the car door after getting out. She starts to cry as Buddy's Jaguar speeds off, leaving her alone in the parking lot. Her eyes are closed tightly by Carolyn, who tries to stop the tears, and suddenly a loud scream is given by her, the sound still muffled. The weights are put down by the Colonel, and his reflection is looked at in the window by him, seeing his pumped arms, before a cigar box is reached under the bench by him. He smiles, opens it, and marijuana paraphernalia is dug through by him, only to find an empty Ziploc bag. Ricky and the Colonel eat in silence at the table, when Ricky pulls off his beeper and checks it, then uneasy feelings are left with the Colonel as Ricky heads into the hall. It's raining outside, and the car is driven by Angela, squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth. Something outside catches the Colonel's eye, and his neck is craned for a better look. Through a window over the sink, blurred by the rain, Lester pumps his upper body, glistening in sweat in the Burnham's garage, as a wad of bills is counted out by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Deeply troubled, the Colonel enters quietly and searches Ricky's bureau, missing the false bottom hiding marijuana. He notices a Digicam and cassettes, then swaps the tape and watches the TV, entranced. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts stares blankly at the kitchen table. Later, wearing only black socks, the Colonel lifts dumbbells, admiring his reflection in the window as the camera stays connected to the TV. Lester flips burgers in his Mr. Smiley's uniform, smiling after a brief moment of tension. Carolyn drives a Mercedes to the drive-thru, with Buddy unaware of Lester watching them. Lester grins at Carolyn as she reacts, trying to stay composed. Ominous clouds fill the sky, and the wind scatters trash as Carolyn parks next to Buddy's Jaguar. She grips the wheel, crying as Buddy leaves, eventually screaming into the silence. The Colonel puts down the weights, checks his reflection, and rummages through a cigar box, finding only an empty Ziploc bag. Ricky and the Colonel eat silently until Ricky checks his beeper and leaves, unsettling the Colonel. It's raining outside as Angela drives, squinting through the wipers. The Colonel sees something intriguing, looking through a rain-streaked window at Lester in the Burnham's garage, his body pumped and counting money.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Colonel, troubled, enters silently and searches Ricky's bureau, missing the false bottom with marijuana. He notices a Digicam and cassettes on a shelf. Barbara Fitts stares at the kitchen table. The Colonel switches cassettes, watching TV intensely, then sits on Ricky's bed. Later, naked except black socks, he lifts dumbbells, watching himself in the window, as the camera stays connected to the TV. Lester, in a Mr. Smiley's uniform, grills burgers happily. Hearing something, he looks up, then smiles and puts his spatula down. Carolyn drives a Mercedes to the drive-thru, Buddy beside her, unaware of Lester watching. Lester grins at Carolyn handing her food, while the Counter Girl stares blankly. Carolyn almost jumps but acts nonchalant. Dark clouds fill the sky; wind scatters trash as her Mercedes parks near Buddy's Jaguar. Carolyn clutches the wheel, staring ahead. Buddy exits, looking unhappy. Carolyn cries as Buddy's Jaguar speeds away. She closes her eyes, tries to stop tears, and screams, the sound muffled. The Colonel puts down weights, admiring his reflection, then finds an empty Ziploc in a cigar box. Ricky and the Colonel silently eat; Ricky checks his beeper and leaves the Colonel uneasy. It's raining; Angela drives, squinting through the blurred windshield. The Colonel cranes his neck, seeing Lester in the Burnham's garage, counting out bills, pumped and sweaty.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The Colonel, who appears visibly disturbed and deeply troubled, enters the room silently and begins to methodically search through Ricky's bureau in a quiet yet determined manner. He carefully opens a drawer where Ricky is known to keep his stash of marijuana, but he fails to discover the cleverly concealed false bottom. Rising to his feet, the Colonel takes a moment to glance around the room. His eyes settle on the Digicam and a haphazard stack of cassettes resting on a nearby shelf. Meanwhile, in another part of the house, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table lost in her thoughts, staring off into space. The Colonel, with a sense of urgency, removes the cassette from the Digicam and inserts a new one. His face tightens with a mix of emotions as he watches the footage on the TV screen. Slowly and deliberately, he sinks down onto Ricky's bed, completely mesmerized by what he sees. 

At a later time, the Colonel, now stripped of all his clothes except for a pair of black socks, reaches for the dumbbells. He begins to lift them, observing his own reflection in the window with intense focus. The camera remains hooked up to the television, capturing everything. In a different setting, Lester is noticeably cheerful as he dons a Mr. Smiley's uniform while expertly flipping burgers on a sizzling grill. Suddenly, prompted by a noise, he looks up with a face that briefly darkens but then breaks into a wide smile as he places his spatula down. Carolyn drives her Mercedes up to the drive-thru window with Buddy seated beside her, seemingly too engaged in conversation to notice Lester observing them intently. Leaning out of the window with a grin, Lester hands Carolyn bags filled with fast food, while the Counter Girl stands by him, her expression blank and distant. Carolyn nearly jumps out of her skin in surprise but struggles to maintain an appearance of calmness. 

The sky above becomes ominously overcast with gray clouds, and a fierce wind begins to whip bits of garbage across the parking lot as Carolyn's Mercedes parks next to Buddy's Jaguar. Carolyn grips the steering wheel tightly, staring straight ahead, while Buddy gazes at her with an unhappy expression. He eventually steps out of the car, closing the door behind him. Left alone in the parking lot, Carolyn begins to cry. As Buddy's Jaguar speeds away, she is engulfed by her emotions. Closing her eyes tightly, she tries desperately to hold back her tears and then, unable to contain them, she lets out a loud, muffled scream. Simultaneously, the Colonel, having put down the weights, studies his reflection in the window, admiring the sight of his pumped arms. He then reaches under the bench for a cigar box, smiling as he opens it. He rummages through marijuana paraphernalia only to find a disappointingly empty Ziploc bag. 

Ricky and the Colonel later find themselves seated together at the table, eating in a silence that feels weighty. Ricky suddenly removes his beeper from his belt to check it, prompting him to head into the hall, leaving the Colonel feeling uneasy. Outside, the rain pours down as Angela drives, squinting through the windshield with the wipers going back and forth rhythmically. Something outside catches the Colonel's eye, causing him to crane his neck for a better look. Through a window above the rain-blurred sink, Lester is faintly visible in the Burnham's garage, his upper body glistening with sweat as he counts out a substantial wad of bills.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The Colonel, whose demeanor reveals a man visibly disturbed and deeply troubled, silently steps into the dimly lit room. With quiet determination, he begins a methodical search through Ricky's cluttered bureau. His actions are deliberate as he carefully opens a particular drawer, the one where Ricky is known to keep his clandestine stash of marijuana. However, despite his thorough inspection, he fails to uncover the cleverly concealed false bottom within. Rising slowly to his feet, the Colonel pauses momentarily to glance around the room. His eyes soon fix upon the Digicam alongside a precariously stacked pile of cassettes that rests on a nearby shelf. Meanwhile, in a different part of the house, Barbara Fitts remains seated at the kitchen table, utterly absorbed in her thoughts and staring blankly into space. Driven by a sense of urgency, the Colonel removes the cassette from the Digicam and replaces it with a new one. His face tightens, reflecting a complex mix of emotions as he watches the footage unfold on the TV screen. Slowly and with purpose, he sinks down onto Ricky's bed, completely mesmerized by the scenes he observes.

Later on, at a different moment in time, the Colonel is seen having stripped off all his clothing, save for a simple pair of black socks. He reaches for the dumbbells, starting to lift them with a focused intensity as he observes his own reflection in the glass of the window. The camera remains connected to the television, capturing every single detail of his actions. In an entirely different setting, Lester is unmistakably cheerful as he wears a Mr. Smiley's uniform, skillfully flipping burgers over a sizzling grill. Suddenly, prompted by an unexpected noise, he looks up, his expression briefly darkening before it transforms into a broad smile. He places his spatula down with a flourish. Meanwhile, Carolyn is driving her sleek Mercedes up to the drive-thru window, with Buddy seated comfortably beside her. Both seem too engrossed in their ongoing conversation to notice that Lester is observing them with keen interest. Leaning out of the window with a wide grin, Lester hands Carolyn bags filled to the brim with fast food, while the Counter Girl stands by his side, her expression blank and distant. Carolyn nearly jumps out of her skin in surprise but strives to maintain an outward appearance of calm composure.

The sky above begins to darken ominously as gray clouds gather, casting a shadow over the scene. A fierce wind starts to whip around bits of garbage, swirling them across the parking lot as Carolyn maneuvers her Mercedes to park next to Buddy's sleek Jaguar. Gripping the steering wheel tightly, Carolyn stares straight ahead, expression tense, while Buddy merely gazes at her with an unhappy frown. Eventually, he steps out of the car, shutting the door with a soft thud before walking away. Left completely alone in the parking lot, Carolyn is overcome by a wave of emotions and begins to cry. As Buddy's Jaguar speeds away, her emotions engulf her entirely. She closes her eyes tightly, desperately trying to suppress the tears, but eventually she lets out a loud, muffled scream that echoes her inner turmoil. Simultaneously, the Colonel, having placed the weights back down, studies his reflection in the window, clearly admiring the sight of his pumped arms. He reaches under the bench for a cigar box, grinning as he opens it. However, as he rummages through the marijuana paraphernalia, he is met only by the sight of a disappointingly empty Ziploc bag.

Later still, Ricky and the Colonel find themselves seated together at the table, engaging in a meal shared in a silence that feels heavy and oppressive. Suddenly, Ricky removes a beeper from his belt, checks it, and then heads into the hall, leaving the Colonel behind feeling uneasy and unsettled. Outside, rain pours down relentlessly as Angela drives, squinting through the windshield while the wipers go back and forth in a rhythmic dance. Something outside catches the Colonel's attention, causing him to crane his neck in an attempt to get a better view. Through a window above the rain-blurred sink, Lester is faintly visible in the Burnham's garage, with his upper body glistening with sweat as he counts out a substantial wad of bills.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Colonel, burdened by deep trouble, quietly pushes open the door and steps inside, his movements silent and deliberate. He walks over to Ricky's bureau with a sense of urgency and begins methodically examining its contents. As he pulls open a specific drawer known to hold Ricky's marijuana, his search is thorough yet unsuccessful, as he fails to notice the cleverly concealed false bottom. Rising to his feet, he takes a moment to survey the room, his eyes scanning over the Digicam and a neatly arranged stack of cassettes resting on a shelf. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts sits motionless at the kitchen table, her gaze distant and unfocused. The Colonel methodically extracts the cassette from the Digicam and replaces it with another, his facial expression hardening as he turns his attention to the TV screen, which now displays the new footage. Slowly, almost unwillingly, he lowers himself onto Ricky's bed, becoming entirely captivated by what he sees. The scene shifts to later, where the Colonel is now stripped completely naked save for his black socks, a stark image as he reaches for a pair of dumbbells. He begins to lift them rhythmically, his eyes fixed on his own reflection in the window, which remains clear despite the lingering connection of the camera to the TV. Simultaneously, Lester, clad in a Mr. Smiley's uniform, is absorbed in the familiar task of flipping burgers expertly on the grill. A sound interrupts him, causing him to abruptly lift his head and his face to darken for a brief moment before his expression softens into a smile, and he sets his spatula down with a sense of satisfaction. At the same time, Carolyn navigates her Mercedes to a drive-thru window, seemingly oblivious to the presence of Buddy sitting beside her, too engrossed in their own world to notice Lester's watchful eyes. Lester leans outward from the window, presenting Carolyn with an enthusiastic grin and several bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl next to him stands, her expression vacant and detached. Startled, Carolyn nearly leaps out of her skin but forces herself to adopt a casual demeanor, attempting to mask her unease. Outside, the sky transforms ominously as gray clouds rapidly gather, and the wind begins to whip discarded debris across the parking lot just as her Mercedes rolls to a stop next to Buddy's Jaguar. With her hands clenching the steering wheel tightly, Carolyn's eyes remain fixed forward, even as Buddy turns to her with an expression of discontent, steps out of the car, and closes the door with finality. As the Jaguar accelerates away, leaving her isolated in the parking lot, Carolyn's composure crumbles. Tears well up, and she shuts her eyes firmly, trying in vain to halt the flood of emotion before erupting into a muted scream of frustration. Back inside, the Colonel sets the weights aside, his gaze lingering on his reflection and the sight of his toned arms, before he reaches beneath the bench to retrieve a well-worn cigar box. His face lights with a fleeting smile as he flips open the lid and sifts through an assortment of marijuana paraphernalia, only to be met with disappointment at the sight of an empty Ziploc bag. At the table, Ricky and the Colonel sit opposite each other, their meal shared in tense silence, until Ricky detaches his beeper from his belt, scrutinizes the message, and abruptly exits the room into the hallway, leaving the Colonel stewing in unease. Outside, rain pours steadily as Angela navigates the road, her eyes narrowed against the downpour, and wipers swinging rhythmically to clear her view. Meanwhile, the Colonel, observing through the rain-dappled window over the sink, catches sight of something that stirs his curiosity, causing him to crane his neck for a clearer view. Through the obscuring raindrops, Lester becomes visible in the Burnham's garage, his upper body gleaming with sweat as he meticulously counts a wad of bills, the rain continuing its persistent patter against the windowpane.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Colonel, deeply troubled, enters quietly and searches through Ricky's bureau, missing the false bottom of a drawer with marijuana. He notices a Digicam and cassettes on a shelf, swaps the cassette in the camera, and becomes engrossed watching the screen, sinking onto Ricky's bed in fascination. Later, the Colonel, wearing only black socks, lifts dumbbells while watching his reflection, with the camera still linked to the TV. Meanwhile, Lester, in a Mr. Smiley's uniform, cheerfully flips burgers but becomes alert upon hearing something, smiles, and sets the spatula aside. Carolyn drives to a drive-thru with Buddy, unaware of Lester watching them. Lester leans out, grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food, surprising her while she tries to remain composed. As ominous clouds fill the sky and winds scatter garbage, Carolyn parks beside Buddy's Jaguar, gripping the wheel tightly. Buddy looks on unhappily before leaving, prompting Carolyn to cry alone in the parking lot. She closes her eyes to stop the tears and suddenly screams out, the sound muffled. The Colonel finishes his workout, admires his reflection, and reaches for a cigar box under the bench, smiling as he discovers an empty Ziploc in the marijuana paraphernalia. During a silent meal, Ricky checks his beeper, making the Colonel uneasy before Ricky heads into the hall. Meanwhile, Angela drives in the rain, squinting through the windshield. The Colonel notices something outside, craning for a better look, and sees, through a rain-blurred window, Lester in the Burnhams’ garage, pumped and sweaty, counting a wad of bills.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The Colonel, deeply troubled by recent events in the family, enters silently through the door of their suburban home and starts going through Ricky's bureau, a piece of furniture that has been in the family for generations. He opens a drawer where Ricky, who is known around the neighborhood for his secretive behavior, keeps his marijuana but doesn't discover its false bottom, a clever hiding place designed to evade detection. The Colonel stands and looks around, noticing the Digicam, a popular handheld video camera from the early 2000s, and a stack of cassettes on a shelf filled with recordings of family memories. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table, staring off into space, lost in thoughts of her own unfulfilled aspirations. The Colonel takes the cassette out of the Digicam and inserts another, his face tightening as he views the TV screen showing something unexpected. He sinks slowly onto Ricky's bed, mesmerized by the images. Later, naked except for his black socks, which contrast starkly with his pale skin, the Colonel grabs dumbbells from a set of weights he bought years ago in an attempt to gain strength, and starts lifting them, watching his reflection in the window of their quiet, dimly lit bedroom. The camera remains connected to the TV, silently recording the tension. Lester, wearing a Mr. Smiley's uniform with the cheerful logo of the fast-food chain, happily flips burgers on a grill that has seen better days. He suddenly looks up when he hears something, his face darkening with familiar suspicion, but then he smiles and puts his spatula down, recalling a happier moment. Carolyn drives a Mercedes, a symbol of her aspirations for a higher social status, to the drive-thru window, with Buddy sitting beside her, too involved in his phone call to notice Lester watching them intently from the window. Lester leans out of the window, grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl, a teenager disinterested in her surroundings, stands next to him staring blankly. Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin but struggles to appear nonchalant, aware of being observed. The sky fills with ominous gray clouds, suggesting an impending storm, and wind whips garbage across the parking lot as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar, a car he'd bought to impress clients. Gripping the wheel tightly, Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy looks at her unhappily, then gets out of the car and shuts the door with finality. She starts to cry as Buddy's Jaguar speeds off, leaving her alone in the parking lot with her thoughts. Carolyn closes her eyes tightly, tries to stop the tears, and suddenly screams as loud as she can, the sound still muffled by the confines of her car. The Colonel puts down the weights and looks at his reflection in the window, seeing his pumped arms, before reaching under the bench to grab a cigar box where he keeps what remains of his old vices. He smiles, opens it, and digs through marijuana paraphernalia, remnants of his past indulgences, only to find an empty Ziploc bag that once held his stash. Ricky and the Colonel sit at the table, eating in silence, when Ricky pulls his beeper off his belt, a relic of the pre-smartphone era, and checks it, then heads into the hall, leaving the Colonel uneasy and wondering about his son's secretive habits. It's raining outside, a downpour consistent with the region's unpredictable weather, and Angela drives, squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth to clear her view. The Colonel sees something outside that catches his eye, craning his neck for a better look at the intriguing scene. Through a window over the sink, blurred by the rain, Lester is visible in the Burnhams' garage, his upper body pumped and glistening in sweat as he counts out a wad of bills, the result of hard work and a side hustle that surprises even himself.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The Colonel deeply troubled enters silently through the door and starts going through Ricky's bureau. He opens a drawer where Ricky keeps his marijuana but does not discover its false bottom. The Colonel stands and looks around noticing the Digicam and a stack of cassettes on a shelf. Meanwhile Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table staring off into space. The Colonel takes the cassette out of the Digicam and inserts another his face tightening as he views the TV screen. He sinks slowly onto Ricky's bed mesmerized. Later naked except for his black socks the Colonel grabs dumbbells and starts lifting them watching his reflection in the window. The camera remains connected to the TV. Lester wearing a Mr Smiley's uniform happily flips burgers on a grill. He suddenly looks up when he hears something his face darkening but then he smiles and puts his spatula down. Carolyn drives a Mercedes to the drivethru window with Buddy sitting beside her too involved to notice Lester watching them. Lester leans out of the window grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring blankly. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin but struggles to appear nonchalant. The sky fills with ominous gray clouds and wind whips garbage across the parking lot as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar. Gripping the wheel tightly. Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy looks at her unhappily then gets out of the car and shuts the door. She starts to cry as Buddy's Jaguar speeds off leaving her alone in the parking lot. Carolyn closes her eyes tightly tries to stop the tears and suddenly screams as loud as she can the sound still muffled. The Colonel puts down the weights and looks at his reflection in the window seeing his pumped arms before reaching under the bench to grab a cigar box. He smiles opens it and digs through marijuana paraphernalia only to find an empty Ziploc bag. Ricky and the Colonel sit at the table eating in silence when Ricky pulls his beeper off his belt and checks it then heads into the hall leaving the Colonel uneasy. It is raining outside and Angela drives squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth. The Colonel sees something outside that catches his eye craning his neck for a better look. Through a window over the sink blurred by the rain. Lester is visible in the Burnham's garage his upper body pumped and glistening in sweat as he counts out a wad of bills.

It suddenly looks up when it hears something, its face darkening, but then it smiles and puts its spatula down. The panda drives a Mercedes to the drive-thru window, with the cat sitting beside it, too involved to notice the penguin watching them. The penguin leans out of the window, grinning at the panda with bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl stands next to it staring blankly. The panda almost jumps out of its skin but struggles to appear nonchalant. The sky fills with ominous gray clouds, and wind whips garbage across the parking lot as its Mercedes pulls in next to the cat's Jaguar. Gripping the wheel tightly, the panda stares straight ahead while the cat looks at it unhappily, then gets out of the car and shuts the door. It starts to cry as the cat's Jaguar speeds off, leaving it alone in the parking lot. The panda closes its eyes tightly, tries to stop the tears, and suddenly screams as loud as it can, the sound still muffled. The dolphin puts down the weights and looks at its reflection in the window, seeing its pumped arms, before reaching under the bench to grab a cigar box. It smiles, opens it, and digs through marijuana paraphernalia, only to find an empty Ziploc bag. The owl and the dolphin sit at the table, eating in silence, when the owl pulls its beeper off its belt and checks it, then heads into the hall, leaving the dolphin uneasy. It's raining outside, and the fox drives, squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth. The dolphin sees something outside that catches its eye, craning its neck for a better look. test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Colonel, deeply troubled, enters silently through the gate and starts going through Ricky's wardrobe. He opens a compartment where Ricky keeps his collection of stamps but doesn't discover its false bottom. The Colonel stands and looks around, noticing the film projector and a stack of LP records on a shelf. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts sits at the living room sofa, staring off into space. The Colonel takes the record out of the film projector and inserts another, his face tightening as he views the movie screen. He sinks slowly onto Ricky's couch, mesmerized. Later, naked except for his white slippers, the Colonel grabs a set of golf clubs and starts swinging them, watching his reflection in the microwave. The projector remains connected to the screen. Lester, wearing a Mr. Jolly's uniform, happily arranges pastries on a tray. He suddenly looks up when he hears something, his face darkening, but then he smiles and puts his pastry tongs down. Carolyn drives a BMW to the ticket booth, with Buddy sitting beside her, too involved to notice Lester watching them. Lester leans out of the booth, grinning at Carolyn with boxes of pastries, while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring blankly. Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin but struggles to appear nonchalant. The sky fills with ominous gray clouds, and wind whips leaves across the parking lot as her BMW parks next to Buddy's Porsche. Gripping the wheel tightly, Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy looks at her unhappily, then gets out of the car and shuts the door. She starts to cry as Buddy's Porsche speeds off, leaving her alone in the parking lot. Carolyn closes her eyes tightly, tries to stop the tears, and suddenly screams as loud as she can, the sound still muffled. The Colonel puts down the golf clubs and looks at his reflection in the microwave, seeing his toned legs, before reaching under the recliner to grab a shoebox. He smiles, opens it, and digs through coin-collecting tools, only to find an empty velvet pouch. Ricky and the Colonel sit at the counter, eating in silence, when Ricky pulls his walkie-talkie off his belt and checks it, then heads into the corridor, leaving the Colonel uneasy. It's raining outside, and Angela drives, squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth. The Colonel sees something outside that catches his eye, craning his neck for a better look. Through a window over the kitchen table, blurred by the rain, Lester is visible in the Burnham's attic, his upper body toned and glistening in sweat as he counts out a stack of postcards.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The Colonel, deeply troubled, sneaks silently through the door and begins examining Ricky's bureau. He closes a drawer where Ricky hides his marijuana but overlooks its false bottom. The Colonel kneels and observes around, spotting the Digicam and a stack of cassettes on a shelf. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts stands at the kitchen table, gazing off into space. The Colonel removes the cassette from the Digicam and swaps it with another, his face twitching as he studies the TV screen. He drops slowly onto Ricky's bed, captivated. Later, dressed only in his black socks, the Colonel picks up dumbbells and starts twisting them, peering at his reflection in the window. The camera stays connected to the TV. Lester, wearing a Mr. Smiley's uniform, casually arranges burgers on a grill. He suddenly glances up when he hears something, his face falling, but then he grins and places his spatula down. Carolyn navigates a Mercedes to the drive-thru window, with Buddy sitting beside her, too absorbed to notice Lester observing them. Lester leans out of the window, beaming at Carolyn with bags of fast food, while the Counter Girl stands next to him blinking blankly. Carolyn nearly leaps out of her skin but struggles to appear calm. The sky loads with ominous gray clouds, and wind propels garbage across the parking lot as her Mercedes glides in next to Buddy's Jaguar. Clutching the wheel tightly, Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy glances at her sadly, then exits the car and slams the door. She starts to sob as Buddy's Jaguar accelerates off, leaving her isolated in the parking lot. Carolyn shuts her eyes tightly, tries to halt the tears, and suddenly yells as loud as she can, the sound still muted. The Colonel puts down the weights and gazes at his reflection in the window, seeing his firm arms, before reaching under the bench to snatch a cigar box. He beams, opens it, and sifts through marijuana paraphernalia, only to find an empty Ziploc bag. Ricky and the Colonel sit at the table, dining in silence, when Ricky unclips his beeper from his belt and examines it, then marches into the hall, leaving the Colonel unsettled. It's pouring outside, and Angela drives, peering through the windshield as the wipers sway back and forth. The Colonel notices something outside that grabs his attention, twisting his neck for a better look. Through a window over the sink, blurred by the rain, Lester is visible in the Burnham's garage, his upper body firm and glistening in sweat as he sorts out a wad of bills.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Blender, deeply troubled, enters silently through the curtain and starts going through Robin's mailbox. It opens a compartment where Robin keeps her wardrobe but doesn't discover its false bottom. The Blender stands and looks around, noticing the Stapler and a pile of towels on a shelf. Meanwhile, Sylvia Printer sits at the living room chair, staring off into space. The Blender takes the towel out of the Stapler and inserts another, its face tightening as it views the microwave screen. It sinks slowly onto Robin's sofa, mesmerized. Later, naked except for its red sneakers, the Blender grabs umbrellas and starts lifting them, watching its reflection in the mirror. The pencil remains connected to the microwave. Terrence, wearing a Mr. Giggle's costume, happily flips pancakes on a pan. It suddenly looks up when it hears something, its face darkening, but then it smiles and puts its whisk down. Janet drives a Cadillac to the amusement park gate, with Trevor sitting beside her, too involved to notice Terrence watching them. Terrence leans out of the gate, grinning at Janet with piles of sandwiches, while the Cashier Boy stands next to it staring blankly. Janet almost jumps out of her trousers but struggles to appear nonchalant. The ocean fills with ominous gray waves, and wind whips clothing across the sidewalk as her Cadillac pulls in next to Trevor's Mustang. Gripping the wheel tightly, Janet stares straight ahead while Trevor looks at her unhappily, then gets out of the cart and shuts the hatch. She starts to sob as Trevor's Mustang speeds off, leaving her alone in the sidewalk. Janet closes her eyes tightly, tries to stop the tears, and suddenly screams as loud as she can, the sound still muffled. The Blender puts down the umbrellas and looks at its reflection in the mirror, seeing its pumped legs, before reaching under the dresser to grab a basket. It smiles, opens it, and digs through hat accessories, only to find an empty envelope. Robin and the Blender sit at the couch, eating in silence, when Robin pulls her watch off her wrist and checks it, then heads into the corridor, leaving the Blender uneasy. It's snowing outside, and Alice bikes, squinting through the goggles as the wipers move back and forth. The Blender sees something outside that catches its eye, craning its head for a better look. Through a skylight over the desk, blurred by the snow, Terrence is visible in the Brown's kitchen, its upper body pumped and glistening in sweat as it counts out a pile of coins.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The Magician, deeply intrigued, slips quietly through the window and begins sorting through Peter's wardrobe. He examines a compartment where Peter stores his gemstones but doesn't uncover its hidden compartment. The Magician crouches and glances around, observing the Polaroid camera and a stack of magazines on a shelf. Meanwhile, Sarah Palmer lounges on the living room sofa, gazing into the distance. The Magician extracts the magazine from the Polaroid camera and inserts another, his brow furrowing as he inspects the computer screen. He collapses gently onto Peter's couch, captivated. Later, clad only in his red socks, the Magician seizes brushes and begins painting them, admiring his silhouette in the mirror. The camera remains attached to the computer. Michael, donning a Chef’s apron, joyfully kneads dough on a counter. He suddenly glances up when he perceives something, his demeanor darkening, but then he chuckles and sets his rolling pin down. Jennifer steers a Volkswagen to the service window, with Sam sitting beside her, too occupied to observe Michael observing them. Michael leans out of the window, beaming at Jennifer with trays of pastries, while the Cashier Guy stands next to him gaping idly. Jennifer nearly jumps out of her skin but struggles to seem unfazed. The sky fills with threatening dark clouds, and wind scatters leaves across the courtyard as her Volkswagen parks next to Sam's Audi. Clutching the steering wheel firmly, Jennifer stares directly ahead while Sam glances at her discontentedly, then exits the car and closes the door. She begins to laugh as Sam's Audi races off, leaving her solitary in the courtyard. Jennifer shuts her eyes tightly, tries to contain the laughter, and suddenly bursts as loud as she can, the sound still muted. The Magician sets down the brushes and looks at his silhouette in the mirror, noticing his painted arms, before reaching beneath the table to fetch a music box. He grins, opens it, and sifts through gemstone accessories, only to find an empty velvet pouch. Peter and the Magician sit at the booth, dining in silence, when Peter detaches his pager from his pocket and examines it, then proceeds into the corridor, leaving the Magician unsettled. It's snowing outside, and Megan navigates, peering through the windshield as the wipers glide back and forth. The Magician observes something outside that seizes his attention, stretching his neck for a clearer view. Through a window above the sink, blurred by the snow, Michael is visible in the Burnham's studio, his torso painted and illuminated in light as he counts out a collection of postcards.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The Colonel, deeply troubled, tiptoes quietly through the curtain and starts rummaging through Ricky's cabinet. He peeks into a compartment where Ricky hides his tomatoes but doesn't realize its hidden compartment. The Colonel crouches and peers around, noticing the Polaroid and a pile of scrolls on a mantelpiece. Meanwhile, Barbara Fitts perches at the living room couch, gazing off into nothingness. The Colonel takes the scroll out of the Polaroid and inserts another, his face twitching as he scans the computer monitor. He perches slowly onto Ricky's chair, captivated. Later, clad only in his white sandals, the Colonel grips barbells and begins twirling them, admiring his reflection in the mirror. The stereo remains linked to the monitor. Lester, donned in a Mr. Smiley's outfit, joyously spins sausages on a skillet. He abruptly glances up when he senses something, his face clouding, but then he grins and places his tongs down. Carolyn navigates a bicycle to the takeaway counter, with Buddy sitting beside her, too distracted to notice Lester observing them. Lester leans out of the counter, beaming at Carolyn with cartons of snacks, while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring vacantly. Carolyn nearly leaps out of her seat but strives to look collected. The atmosphere fills with threatening dark birds, and breeze tosses leaves across the lot as her bicycle pulls in next to Buddy's moped. Clutching the handlebars tightly, Carolyn gazes straight forward while Buddy glances at her grimly, then steps out of the vehicle and closes the hatch. She begins to sob as Buddy's moped zooms off, leaving her by herself in the lot. Carolyn squeezes her eyes shut, attempts to cease the sobbing, and suddenly yells as loudly as she can, the noise still muffled. The Colonel sets down the barbells and peers at his reflection in the mirror, noticing his muscular legs, before reaching under the shelf to grab a music box. He grins, opens it, and sifts through peppermint wrappers, only to find an empty glass jar. Ricky and the Colonel settle at the counter, munching in silence, when Ricky removes his pager from his pocket and inspects it, then proceeds into the corridor, leaving the Colonel edgy. It's drizzling outside, and Angela rides, peering through the glass as the wipers sway back and forth. The Colonel spots something inside that catches his attention, stretching his neck for a clearer view. Through a window over the cooker, blurred by the drizzle, Lester is observable in the Burnham's workshop, his upper body strong and glistening in sweat as he counts out a handful of tickets.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Astronaut, mildly curious, tiptoes eagerly through the entrance and finishes rummaging through Kevin's closet. She closes a compartment where Kevin stores his confetti but doesn't realize its secret compartment. The Astronaut crouches and glances about, spotting the Telescope and a pile of scrolls on a counter. Meanwhile, Diane Fisher reclines on the sofa, gazing intently into the distance. The Astronaut slides the scroll out of the Telescope and places another, her expression relaxing as she examines the projector screen. She floats swiftly onto Kevin's hammock, captivated. Later, cloaked except for her pink slippers, the Astronaut grips kettlebells and commences swinging them, scrutinizing her silhouette in the mirror. The microphone stays linked to the projector. Murray, sporting a Fancy Hat's apron, joyfully juggles pancakes on a skillet. He abruptly glances sideways when he detects something, his expression brightening, but then he frowns and places his whisk down. Samantha steers a Volkswagen to the pickup counter, with Sam lounging beside her, too distracted to observe Murray observing them. Murray leans into the counter, beaming at Samantha with stacks of cupcakes, while the Usher Boy stands behind him blinking absentmindedly. Samantha nearly leaps out of her seat but endeavors to appear serene. The ocean fills with threatening dark waves, and rain sweeps leaves across the courtyard as her Volkswagen parks beside Sam's Ferrari. Grasping the handle firmly, Samantha gazes directly forward while Sam observes her thoughtfully, then exits the vehicle and slams the trunk. She begins to laugh as Sam's Ferrari zooms away, abandoning her alone in the courtyard. Samantha shuts her eyes gently, attempts to stifle the laughter, and suddenly whispers as softly as she can, the noise still muted. The Astronaut lays down the kettlebells and examines her silhouette in the mirror, admiring her bulky legs, before bending beneath the bench to seize a cookie jar. She grins, unlids it, and rifles through frosting supplies, only to find a vacant paper bag. Kevin and the Astronaut lounge on the couch, snacking in quiet, when Kevin detaches his watch from his wrist and reviews it, then marches into the corridor, leaving the Astronaut nervous. It's snowing outdoors, and Emma flies, peering through the porthole as the propellers spin incessantly. The Astronaut perceives something indoors that attracts her attention, twisting her neck for a clearer view. Through a portal above the stove, smudged by the snow, Murray is discernible in the Burnham's den, his upper half chiseled and sparkling in droplets as he counts out a bundle of coins.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Colonel, troubled, searches Ricky's bureau but misses the false bottom hiding marijuana. He swaps cassettes in Ricky's Digicam, captivated by the playback. Later, the Colonel lifts dumbbells naked except for socks, watching himself in the reflection. Meanwhile, Lester grills burgers in a Mr. Smiley's uniform. Carolyn, with Buddy, drives to a fast-food window where Lester serves them, grinning, while the Counter Girl stares blankly. Carolyn acts nonchalant but jumps at seeing Lester. As ominous clouds gather, Buddy departs, leaving Carolyn to scream alone in the parking lot. The Colonel, examining his pumped reflection, finds an empty Ziploc in a cigar box of marijuana items. During a silent meal, Ricky checks his beeper, making the Colonel uneasy. Angela drives through rain as the Colonel notices Lester in the garage, sweaty and holding cash.

the windshield as the wipers move back and forth Lester leans out of the window grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring blankly Carolyn closes her eyes tightly tries to stop the tears and suddenly screams as loud as she can the sound still muffled He opens a drawer where Ricky keeps his marijuana but does not discover its false bottom Gripping the wheel tightly The Colonel sees something outside that catches his eye craning his neck for a better look The sky fills with ominous gray clouds and wind whips garbage across the parking lot as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar The Colonel stands and looks around noticing the Digicam and a stack of cassettes on a shelf Through a window over the sink blurred by the rain The Colonel takes the cassette out of the Digicam and inserts another his face tightening as he views the TV screen Lester is visible in the Burnham's garage his upper body pumped and glistening in sweat as he counts out a wad of bills The camera remains connected to the TV Lester wearing a Mr Smiley's uniform happily flips burgers on a grill The Colonel deeply troubled enters silently through the door and starts going through Ricky's bureau Meanwhile Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table staring off into space Ricky and the Colonel sit at the table eating in silence when Ricky pulls his beeper off his belt and checks it then heads into the hall leaving the Colonel uneasy

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: The sky fills with ominous gray clouds and wind whips garbage across the parking lot as her Mercedes pulls in next to Buddy's Jaguar Gripping the wheel tightly Carolyn stares straight ahead while Buddy looks at her unhappily then gets out of the car and shuts the door She starts to cry as Buddy's Jaguar speeds off leaving her alone in the parking lot Carolyn closes her eyes tightly tries to stop the tears and suddenly screams as loud as she can the sound still muffled The Colonel puts down the weights and looks at his reflection in the window seeing his pumped arms before reaching under the bench to grab a cigar box He smiles opens it and digs through marijuana paraphernalia only to find an empty Ziploc bag Ricky and the Colonel sit at the table eating in silence when Ricky pulls his beeper off his belt and checks it then heads into the hall leaving the Colonel uneasy It is raining outside and Angela drives squinting through the windshield as the wipers move back and forth The Colonel sees something outside that catches his eye craning his neck for a better look Through a window over the sink blurred by the rain Lester is visible in the Burnham's garage his upper body pumped and glistening in sweat as he counts out a wad of bills The Colonel deeply troubled enters silently through the door and starts going through Ricky's bureau He opens a drawer where Ricky keeps his marijuana but does not discover its false bottom The Colonel stands and looks around noticing the Digicam and a stack of cassettes on a shelf Meanwhile Barbara Fitts sits at the kitchen table staring off into space The Colonel takes the cassette out of the Digicam and inserts another his face tightening as he views the TV screen He sinks slowly onto Ricky's bed mesmerized Later naked except for his black socks the Colonel grabs dumbbells and starts lifting them watching his reflection in the window The camera remains connected to the TV Lester wearing a Mr Smiley's uniform happily flips burgers on a grill He suddenly looks up when he hears something his face darkening but then he smiles and puts his spatula down Carolyn drives a Mercedes to the drivethru window with Buddy sitting beside her too involved to notice Lester watching them Lester leans out of the window grinning at Carolyn with bags of fast food while the Counter Girl stands next to him staring blankly Carolyn almost jumps out of her skin but struggles to appear nonchalant
